subject:
Re: [cc-community] A friend's website done using only CC-licensed
	work
body:
You'll all be happy to know I found a better cork photo under BY-SA and have webcited every flickr page.Thanks Mike and Ignasi.FOn 5/2/07, 
Mike Linksvayer <ml@creativecommons.org> wrote:
I suggest using http://webcitation.org to capture works you're going toreuse, as one can change licenses on Flickr without a trace.On Wed, 2007-05-02 at 10:48 -0400, Fred Benenson wrote:
> Wow. Good catch. I could have sworn it was CC-BY'd when I did this.> What happens if it was? I suppose I don't have any proof. I'll go find> another cork photo. :(>> Thanks,
>>>> F>>> On 5/2/07, Ignasi Labastida i Juan <ilabastida@ub.edu> wrote:>         Hi Fred,>>         I just wanted to notice that the cork picture is public but it
>         has "all>         rights reserved" as it is written on the right lower>         corner :-(>>         http://www.flickr.com/photos/winediva/130457645/
>>         Best,>>         Ignasi>>         En/na Fred Benenson ha escrit:>         > http://laurenshockey.com/>         >
>         > A friend of mine is a food writer in New York and asked me>         to do her>         > website. I had some free time last year, so I threw it>         together for her.>         > She wanted some shots of food (obviously) and I suggested we
>         go with>         > Creative Commons licensed images on Flickr. After some>         digging around,>         > we found some great ones licensed under Attribution>         only.  And of course
>         > we were both happy not to have to use (or pay for) stock>         images.>         > Anyway, I figured this list might find it an interesting>         example of a>         > real world application of cc-licensed images.
>         >>         > Best,>         >>         > Fred>         >>         >>         _______________________________________________>         cc-community mailing list
>         cc-community@lists.ibiblio.org>         http://lists.ibiblio.org/mailman/listinfo/cc-community
>> _______________________________________________> cc-community mailing list> cc-community@lists.ibiblio.org> 
http://lists.ibiblio.org/mailman/listinfo/cc-community--  http://wiki.creativecommons.org/User:Mike_Linksvayer_______________________________________________
